src: Assegureu-vos que teniu la mà dreta tan relaxada com sigui possible, sense deixar de tocar totes les notes correctament; a més, heu de mirar de no fer gaires moviments superflus amb els dits. D'aquesta manera, us cansareu el mínim possible. Recordeu que no cal polsar les tecles amb més força per aconseguir més volum, com passa amb el piano. Per tenir més volum en l'acordió s'utilitza la manxa amb més pressió o velocitat.
mt: Make sure that your right hand is as relaxed as possible, without leaving any notes unplayed; in addition, you should try not to make too many unnecessary finger movements. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember that you do not need to press the keys harder to get more volume, as happens with the piano. To have more volume in the accordion, the bellows are used with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: "Un dels problemes més comuns a l'hora de convertir una pel·lícula al format DVD és l'overscan. La majoria de televisions es fan de tal manera que agradin al públic general. Per aquest motiu, a tot allò que veus a la TV se li han retallat les vores, a dalt, a baix i a les vores. Això es fa per a assegurar que la imatge cobreixi tota la pantalla. D'això se'n diu ""overscan"". Malauradament, quan feu un DVD, el més possible és que les voreres quedin tallades, i si el vídeo tenia subtítols massa a prop de la part de baix, no es mostraran del tot."
mt: "One of the most common problems when converting a movie to DVD format is overscan. Most televisions are made in such a way that they appeal to the general public. For this reason, everything you see on TV has its edges trimmed, at the top, at the bottom, and on the sides. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. This is called ""overscan"". Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, the edges are usually cut off, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they will not be shown at all."
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: El pla nord-americà consistia a llençar atacs coordinats des de tres direccions diferents. El general John Cadwalder llançaria un atac divisori contra la guarnició britànica a Bordentown, per tal de blocar qualsevol reforç. El general James Ewing prendria 700 milícies a través del riu a Trenton Ferry, s'apoderaria del pont sobre el Assunpink Creek i evitaria que les tropes enemigues escapessin. La força d'assalt principal, de 2.400 homes, havia de creuar el riu nou milles al nord de Trenton, i després dividir-se en dos grups, un sota Greene i un sota Sullivan, amb l'objectiu de llençar un atac abans de l'alba.
mt: The American plan was to launch coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, to block any reinforcement. General James Ewing would take 700 militiamen across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent the enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force, of 2,400 men, was to cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then divide into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, with the objective of launching an attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Després de la seva adopció pel Congrés el 4 de juliol, es va enviar un esborrany escrit a mà, signat pel president del Congrès, John Hancock i el secretari Charles Thompson a la impremta de John Dunlap situada a uns pocs carrers de distància. Durant la nit es van fer entre 150 i 200 còpies, que avui es coneixen com a ""volants de Dunlap"". La primera lectura pública del document es va dur a terme per John Nixon al pati de l'Independence Hall el 8 de juliol. Se n'envià una a George Washington el 6 de juliol, que la va fer llegir a les seves tropes a Nova York el 9 de juliol. Una còpia va arribar a Londres el 10 d'agost. Els 25 fulletons de Dunlap que encara se sap que existeixen són les còpies supervivents més antigues d'aquest document. La còpia original manuscrita no ha perviscut."
mt: "After its adoption by the Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft, signed by the president of the Congress, John Hancock and the secretary Charles Thompson, was sent to the printing house of John Dunlap located a few blocks away. During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, which are today known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was made by John Nixon in the yard of the Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy arrived in London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides that are known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of this document. The original handwritten draft has not survived."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Els colons, veient aquesta activitat, també van demanar reforços. Les tropes que reforçaren les posicions d'avantguarda inclogueren el 1r i 3r regiment de New Hampshire, de 200 homes, sota el control dels coronels John Stark i James Reed (ambdós esdevingueren més tard generals). Els homes d'Stark van prendre posicions al llarg de la tanca de l'extrem nord de la localització dels colons. Van estendre ràpidament la tanca cap al nord amb un mur de pedra no gaire alt que acabava vora l'aigua en una platja petita, just després que la marea baixa obrís una bretxa al llarg del riu Mystic, al nord-est de la península. Gridley o Stark van plantar una estaca uns 30 metres (100 peus) davant la tanca i van ordenar que ningú no disparés fins que l'exèrcit britànic l'hagués sobrepassat.
mt: The colonists, seeing this activity, also requested reinforcements. Troops that reinforced the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd regiments of New Hampshire, of 200 men, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence at the northern end of the colonists' location. They quickly extended the fence north with a low stone wall that ended near the water at a small beach, just after the low tide opened a gap along the river Mystic, north-east of the peninsula. Gridley or Stark planted a stake 30 metres (100 feet) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the British army had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: L'Antiga Xina tenia una manera única de mostrar èpoques històriques diferents: cada etapa de la Xina o de cada família en el poder era una dinastia diferent. També entre cada dinastia hi havia un període inestable de províncies dividides. El més conegut d'aquests períodes va ser l'època dels 3 Regnes que va tenir lloc durant 60 anys entre les dinasties Han i Jin. En aquests períodes van tenir lloc guerres feroces entre molts de nobles que lluitaven pel tron. L'època dels Tres Regnes fou un dels períodes més sangonents de la Xina antiga, milers de persones van morir lluitant per a asseure's en el seient més alt al gran palau a Xi'an.
mt: The Old China had a unique way of showing different historical eras: each era of China or of each ruling family was a different dynasty. Also between each dynasty there was an unstable period of divided provinces. The most well known of these periods was the Age of the Three Kingdoms that took place during 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During these periods there were fierce wars between many nobles who fought for the throne. The Age of the Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods of old China, thousands of people died fighting to sit on the highest seat in the great palace at Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Les colònies de formigues legionàries també marxen i construeixen el niu en diferents fases. En la fase nòmada, les formigues legionàries marxen de nit i s'aturen a acampar durant el dia. La colònia inicia una fase nòmada quan ha minvat el menjar disponible. Durant aquesta fase, la colònia construeix nius temporals que es canvien diàriament. Cadascuna d'aquestes marxes o desfilades duren aproximadament 17 dies.
mt: Legionary ant colonies also march and build the nest in different phases. In the nomadic phase, legionary ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony initiates a nomadic phase when the food available has decreased. During this phase, the colony builds temporary nests that are changed daily. Each of these marches or parades last approximately 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Molts ritmes que s'observen en la fisiologia i el comportament sovint depenen de manera crucial en la presència de cicles endògens i la seva producció mitjançant rellotges biològics. Els ritmes periòdics, que no són simples respostes a estímuls externs periòdics, s'han documentat en la majoria d'éssers vius, com ara bacteris, fongs, plantes i animals. Els rellotges biològics són oscil·ladors autònoms que segueixen un període d'inèrcia fins i tot en absència de senyals externs.
mt: Many rhythms observed in physiology and behavior often depend crucially on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simple responses to periodic external stimuli, have been documented in most living organisms, such as bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are autonomous oscillators that follow a period of inertia even in the absence of external signals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Una població és el conjunt d'organismes d'una espècie concreta en una àrea geogràfica determinada. Es diuen monomorfs tots els individus d'una població que comparteixen una característica fenotípica en particular. Els individus que mostren diferents variants d'un tret particular són polimòrfics.
mt: A population is the set of organisms of a particular species in a particular geographic area. All individuals in a population that share a particular phenotypic trait are called monomorphic. Individuals that show different variants of a particular trait are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: El turisme basat en la natura atrau a les persones interessades en visitar les zones naturals amb el fi de gaudir del paisatge, incloent la vida silvestre de plantes i animals. Entre els exemples d'activitats in situ s'inclouen la caça, la pesca, la fotografia, l'observació d'ocells i la visita de parcs i estudi d'informació de l'ecosistema. Un exemple és visitar, fotografiar i aprendre sobre els orangutans de Borneo.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the landscape, including the wildlife of plants and animals. Examples of in situ activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about the orangutans of Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Cada matí, la gent surt en cotxe dels petits pobles rurals per a anar al seu lloc de treball i passen al costat d'altres el lloc de treball dels quals és el lloc que acaben de deixar. En aquest dinàmic vehicle tothom, d'alguna manera, està connectat amb, i dóna suport a, un sistema de transport basat en cotxes privats. La ciència ens mostra avui que aquesta descomunal economia del carbó ha desencaixat un dels estats estables de la biosfera, que ha donat suport a l'evolució de l'home durant els dos darrers milions d'anys.
mt: Every morning, people drive their cars from the small rural villages to their place of work and pass by the place of work of those who are the place they just left. In this dynamic vehicle everyone, somehow, is connected with, and supports, a car-based transportation system. Science shows us today that this colossal carbon economy has destabilized one of the stable states of the biosphere, which has supported human evolution for the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: L'àtom es pot considerar un dels blocs de construcció fonamentals de tota la matèria. És una entitat molt complexa que consisteix, segons un model de Bohr simplificat, en un nucli central orbitat per electrons, similar d'alguna manera als planetes que orbiten el sol - vegeu la Figura 1.1. El nucli consisteix en dues partícules - neutrons i protons. Els protons tenen una càrrega elèctrica positiva mentre que els neutrons no tenen càrrega. Els electrons tenen una càrrega elèctrica negativa.
mt: The atom can be considered one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex entity that consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, similar in some ways to the planets that orbit the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Pràcticament tots els ordinadors que fem servir avui es basen en la manipulació d'informació que es codifica en forma de nombres binaris. Un número binari només pot tenir un de dos valors possibles, és a dir, 0 o 1, i aquests números es coneixen com a dígits binaris o bits, segons l'argot informàtic.
mt: Almost all computers we use today are based on the manipulation of information that is encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can only have one of two possible values, that is, 0 or 1, and these numbers are known as binary digits or bits, according to the jargon of the computer.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Pràcticament tots els ordinadors que fem servir avui es basen en la manipulació d'informació que es codifica en forma de nombres binaris. Un número binari només pot tenir un de dos valors possibles, és a dir, 0 o 1, i aquests números es coneixen com a dígits binaris o bits, segons l'argot informàtic.
mt: Almost all computers we use today are based on the manipulation of information that is encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can only have one of two possible values, that is, 0 or 1, and these numbers are known as binary digits or bits, according to the jargon of the computer.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Els blogs també poden ajudar a millorar l'escriptura dels alumnes. Tot i que els estudiants solen iniciar la seva experiència de bloguer amb una gramàtica i ortografia descuidades, això sol canviar amb l'existència d'un públic. Com que els estudiants són sovint el públic més crític, el bloguer comença a esforçar-se per millorar l'escriptura per evitar les crítiques. A més, els blogs ""obliguen els estudiants a ser més astuts amb el món que els envolta"". La necessitat d'alimentar l'interès de l'audiència inspira als estudiants a ser llestos i curiosos (Toto, 2004). El blogueig és una eina que incentiva la col·laboració i encoratja els estudiants a ampliar l'aprenentatge més enllà de la jornada escolar tradicional. L'ús apropiat de blogs ""pot ajudar els estudiants a ser més analítics i crítics; poden definir les seves postures en el context del qual escriuen els altres i també fer destacar les seves pròpies perspectives en temes concrets responent de manera activa a materials d'internet (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also help improve students' writing. Although students often begin their blogging experience with poor grammar and spelling, this usually changes with the existence of an audience. Because students are often the most critical audience, the blogger begins to try to improve his or her writing to avoid criticism. In addition, blogs ""force students to be more astute about the world around them"". The need to feed the audience's interest inspires students to be quick and curious (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration and encourages students to expand their learning beyond the traditional school day. The appropriate use of blogs ""can help students be more analytical and critical; they can define their positions in the context in which they write others and also highlight their own perspectives on specific issues by actively responding to Internet materials (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: La comunicació asíncrona afavoreix el temps per a la reflexió i reacció als altres. Això permet que els alumnes treballin al seu propi ritme i que controlin del ritme de la informació instructiva. A més a més, hi ha menys restriccions horàries amb la possibilitat de flexibilitzar les hores de feina. (Bremer, 1998) L'ús d'internet i del World Wide Web permet als estudiants de tenir accés a la informació tothora. En comptes d'esperar-se fins a la següent reunió cara a cara, els estudiants també poden presentar preguntes als instructors a qualsevol hora del dia i esperar respostes raonablement ràpides.
mt: Asynchronous communication favors time for reflection and reaction to others. This allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexing work hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to have access to information at any time. Instead of waiting until the next face-to-face meeting, students can also present questions to instructors at any time of the day and expect reasonably quick responses.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: El castell medieval tradicional ha estimulat la imaginació durant molt de temps, evocant imatges de justes, banquets i gallardia arturiana. Fins i tot estant dempeus entre runes mil·lenàries és fàcil que us vinguin a la ment els sorolls i les olors de les batalles d'una altra època, que gairebé sentiu el xoc dels cascs amb les rajoles i que percebeu la por pujant pels finestrons dels calabossos. Ara bé, està la nostra imaginació basada en la realitat? Per què algú va construir castells inicialment? Com va ser el procés de disseny i de construcció?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long stimulated the imagination, evoking images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian gallantry. Even standing amid millennial ruins, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of battles of another age, almost feeling the clash of helmets with the tiles and sensing the fear rising through the windows of the dungeons. But is our imagination based on reality? Why was someone built castles initially? How was the design and construction process?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Típic de l'època, el castell Kirby Muxloe és més com una casa fortificada que no com un castell de debò. Les seves grans finestres de vidre i parets primes no haurien aconseguit resistir un atac durant gaire temps. A la dècada de 1480, quan Lord Hastings va començar a construir-ho, el país es trobava en una situació de pau relativa i només calia la defensa contra petits bàndols de saquejadors errants.
mt: Typical of the era, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more like a fortified house than a proper castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not have been able to withstand an attack for very long. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began building it, the country was in a relatively peaceful state and only needed to defend against small bands of marauding raiders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Amb el canvi de la cursa d'un quart a mitja milla, la velocitat esdevé molt més rellevant i la resistència esdevé una necessitat absoluta. Un corredor de mitja milla de primera classe, un home que pot vèncer dos minuts, evidentment ha de posseir una velocitat considerable, però s'ha de cultivar la resistència a qualsevol mena de perill. Algunes curses de camp a través durant l'hivern, combinada amb treball de gimnàs per la part superior del cos, és la millor preparació per a la temporada de curses.
mt: With the change of the race from a quarter to a half mile, speed becomes much more relevant and resistance becomes an absolute necessity. A first-class half-miler, a man who can win in two minutes, obviously has considerable speed, but he must cultivate resistance to any kind of danger. Some cross-country runs during the winter, combined with upper-body gym work, is the best preparation for the racing season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Les pràctiques nutricionals adequades per si mateixes no poden generar rendiment d'elit, però poden afectar significativament el benestar general dels joves atletes. Mantenir un equilibri energètic saludable, tenir hàbits d'hidratació eficaços i entendre els diferents aspectes de la suplementació pot ajudar els atletes a millorar el rendiment i a gaudir més de l'esport.
mt: Adequate nutritional practices by themselves cannot generate elite performance, but they can significantly affect the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, having effective hydration habits, and understanding the different aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy sports more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: La cursa de mig fons és un esport relativament poc costós; tanmateix, hi ha molta confusió pel que fa a les poques peces d'equipament que calen per a participar-hi. Els productes es poden comprar quan sigui necessari, però la majoria tindran poc o cap impacte real en el rendiment. Els atletes poden tenir la sensació de preferir un producte fins i tot si aquest no ofereix beneficis reals.
mt: The middle-distance race is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there is much confusion as to the few pieces of equipment needed to participate. The products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel the desire to purchase a product even if it offers no real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "Les imatges per ressonància magnètica (IRM) es basen en un fenomen físic que s'anomena ressonància magnètica nuclear (RMN), i que van descobrir a la dècada dels anys trenta del segle passat Felix Bloch (que treballava a la Universitat de Stanford) i Edward Purcell (de la Universitat de Harvard). En aqueixa ressonància, el camp magnètic i les ones de ràdio provoquen que els àtoms emetin petits senyals de ràdio. L'any 1970 Raymond Damadian, un metge i assistent de recerca, va descobrir les bases per a usar l'escaneig de ressonància magnètica com a eina per a la diagnosi mèdica. Quatre anys més tard es va concedir una patent, que va ser la primera patent al món a ser donada en el camp de MRI. L'any 1977, el Dr. Damadian va completar la construcció del primer escàner d'imatges per resonància magnètica ""de cos sencer"", que va batejar com a l'Indomable."
mt: "MRI images are based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (who worked at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University). In this resonance, the magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit small radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and research assistant, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, he was granted a patent, which was the first patent in the world in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first whole-body MRI scanner, which he dubbed the "Indomitable"."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Els humans són de lluny l'espècie més dotada per a llegir la ment dels altres. Això implica que podem predir satisfactòriament què perceben, pretenen, creuen, saben o desitgen altres humans. Entre aquestes habilitats, és essencial entendre les intencions dels altres. Això ens permet resoldre possibles ambigüitats d'accions físiques. Per exemple, si veus que algú trenca la finestra d'un cotxe, probablement donaràs per descomptat que està intentant robar el cotxe d'algú altre. Hauria de ser jutjat d'una altra manera si hagués perdut les seves claus del cotxe i el vehicle que estava intentant forçar hagués estat seu.
mt: Humans are far from the most gifted species at reading minds. This implies that we can predict satisfactorily what others perceive, intend, believe, know, or desire. Among these abilities, it is essential to understand others' intentions. This allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume that they are trying to steal someone else's car. It should be judged differently if they had lost their car keys and the vehicle they were trying to force was theirs.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Tot i que la IA té fortes connotacions de ciència-ficció, forma una branca molt important de la informàtica que estudia el comportament, l'aprenentatge i l'adaptació intel·ligent de màquines. La recerca en IA implica fer màquines per a automatitzar tasques que necessiten un comportament intel·ligent. En són exemples el control, la planificació i la programació, la capacitat de respondre als diagnòstics i preguntes del client així com el reconeixement de l'escriptura, la veu i el rostre. Aquestes coses s'han convertit en disciplines separades que se centren en proporcionar solucions a problemes de la vida real. El sistema de la IA ara s'utilitza freqüentment en àmbits de l'economia, la medicina, l'enginyeria i el militar, ja que s'ha construït en diverses aplicacions informàtiques domèstiques i videojocs.
mt: While AI has strong connotations of science fiction, it is a very important branch of computer science that studies the behavior, learning and adaptive intelligent machines. AI research involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples are control, planning and scheduling, the ability to respond to customer diagnostics and questions as well as handwriting, voice and face recognition. These things have become separate disciplines that focus on providing solutions to real-world problems. The AI system is now used frequently in areas of the economy, medicine, engineering and the military, as it has been built in various home computer applications and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Els patrons de pensament convergent són tècniques de resolució de problemes que uneixen idees o camps diferents per trobar una solució. El focus d'aquesta mentalitat és la velocitat, la lògica i la precisió, també la identificació de fets, tornar a aplicar tècniques existents, el recull d'informació. El factor més important d'aquesta manera de pensar és: hi ha només una resposta correcta. Vosaltres només penseu en dues respostes, és a dir, correcte o equivocat. Aquest tipus de pensament està associat a determinats procediments científics o estàndards. La gent amb aquesta casta de pensament té un pensament lògic, pot memoritzar patrons, resoldre problemes i treballar en proves científiques.
mt: Convergent thinking techniques are problem-solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic, and precision, also the identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, the collection of information. The most important factor of this way of thinking is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, that is, correct or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain scientific procedures or standards. People with this caste of thinking have logical thinking, can memorize patterns, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: L'ús de l'enregistrament de vídeo ha comportat descobertes importants en la interpretació de les micro-expressions, moviments facials que duren uns pocs mil·lisegons. En particular, s'afirma que es pot detectar si una persona menteix interpretant correctament les seves microexpressions. Oliver Sacks, en el seu article El Discurs del Rei, indicava com les persones que no són capaces d'entendre el discurs per culpa de danys cerebrals però així i tot són capaces d'avaluar la sinceritat de forma precisa. Fins i tot suggereix que aquestes capacitats d'interpretació del comportament humà podrien ser compartides per animals com ara gossos domèstics.
mt: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements that last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that it can detect if a person is lying by correctly interpreting their microexpressions. Oliver Sacks, in his article The King's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage but are still able to assess sincerity with precision. He even suggests that these abilities to interpret human behavior could be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: A mesura que la capacitat d'assolir coneixements i aprendre ha canviat, tal com s'ha mencionat anteriorment, també ha canviat la velocitat base amb la qual s'obté el coneixement. La manera d'obtenir informació era diferent. El focus ja no es trobava en la memòria individual, sinó més aviat en la capacitat de recordar un text. En essència, el Renaixement va suposar un canvi significatiu en la forma d'abordar l'aprenentatge i la difusió del coneixement.
mt: As the capacity to acquire knowledge and learn has changed, as mentioned earlier, so has the base speed with which knowledge is obtained. The way of obtaining information was different. The focus was no longer on individual memory, but rather on the ability to remember a text. In essence, the Renaissance represented a significant change in the way of approaching learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Internet combina elements sigui de la comunicació de masses que de la comunicació interpersonal. Les característiques distintives d'Internet porten a dimensions addicionals en termes pel que fa a l'enfocament d'usos i gratificacions. Per exemple, se suggereixen ""aprenentatge"" i ""socialització"" com a motius importants per a l'ús d'internet (James et al., 1995). Implicació personal i ""relacions en curs"" també s'identificaren com a nous aspectes motivadors per Eighmey i McCord (1998), quan van investigar la reacció del públic a llocs web."
mt: "Internet combines elements both of mass communication and interpersonal communication. The distinctive characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the focus of uses and gratifications. For example, learning and socialization are suggested as important motives for Internet use (James et al., 1995). Personal involvement and "ongoing relationships" were also identified as new motivating aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998), when they investigated the public's reaction to web sites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: L'estil gòtic va assolir la màxima popularitat al període entre els segles X i XI, i al segle XIV. Inicialment, la vestimenta estava fortament influïda per la cultura bizantina a orient. Tanmateix, i a causa de la lentitud dels canals de comunicació, els estils podien arribar a l'oest amb 25 a 30 anys de retard. cap al final de l'edat mitjana, l'Europa occidental va començar a desenvolupar el seu propi estil. Un dels majors desenvolupaments de l'època és que, com a resultat de les croades, la gent començà a usar botons per a embotonar la roba.
mt: Gothic fashion reached its peak in popularity between the 10th and 11th centuries, and the 14th century. Initially, the clothing was heavily influenced by Byzantine culture to the east. However, due to the slowness of communication channels, styles could arrive in the west with a 25 to 30 year delay. By the end of the middle ages, western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the major developments of the era is that, as a result of the crusades, people began to use buttons to fasten their clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Podem començar a viure de manera més respectuosa amb el medi ambient, ens podem unir al moviment mediambiental, i podem fins i tot fer-nos activistes per a reduir en part el patiment que podria existir en el futur. Això funciona només com a tractment simptomàtic en la majoria dels casos. Tanmateix, si no volem només una solució temporal, hauríem de trobar l'arrel dels problemes i els hauríem de desactivar. És prou evident que el món ha canviat molt a causa dels avenços científics i tecnològics de la humanitat, i que els problemes han crescut per l'excés de població i l'estil de vida extravagant dels humans.
mt: We can start living more respectfully with the environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even become activists to reduce the suffering that could exist in the future. This works only as symptomatic treatment in most cases. However, if we don't want just a temporary solution, we would have to find the root of the problems and deactivate them. It is quite obvious that the world has changed a lot due to the scientific and technological advances of humanity, and that the problems have grown due to the excess of population and the extravagant lifestyle of humans.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: El balanç de poder era un sistema en què les nacions europees miraven de mantenir la sobirania nacional de tots els estats europeus. El concepte era que totes les nacions europees havien de mirar d'evitar que una sola nació esdevingués massa poderosa, i per a això era freqüent que els governs dels diferents països canviessin les seves aliances a fi de mantenir l'equilibri. La guerra de Successió espanyola va marcar la primera guerra el conflicte principal de la qual era l'equilibri de poder. Això va suposar un gran canvi, ja que les potències europees ja no tindrien el pretext de les guerres religioses. La guerra dels Trenta Anys, per tant, seria considerada la darrera guerra religiosa.
mt: The balance of power was a system in which European nations looked to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations should look to avoid one nation becoming too powerful, and for this reason the governments of different countries would often change their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession marked the first major conflict of the balance of power. This would mark a great change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of religious wars. The Thirty Years' War, therefore, would be considered the last religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Durant aquest període la història europea es va posar en qüestió l'Església Catòlica, que havia esdevingut rica i poderosa. Durant més d'un miler d'anys, la religió cristiana va unir els estats europeus malgrat les diferències d'idioma i costums. El seu poder omnipresent afectà tothom, de reis a plebeus. Un dels principals principis cristians és que la riquesa ha de ser utilitzada per alleujar el sofriment i de la pobresa i que els fons monetaris de l'església existeixen precisament per aquesta raó. L'autoritat principal de l'església havia estat a Roma durant més de mil anys i aquesta concentració de poder i diners va comportar que molta gent es demanés si s'estava complint aquest dogma.
mt: During this period, European history was questioned by the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful. For more than a thousand years, the Christian religion had united the European states despite differences in language and customs. Its omnipresent power affected everyone, from kings to commoners. One of the main Christian principles is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that church funds exist precisely for this reason. The main authority of the church had been in Rome for more than a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money led many people to ask if this dogma was being fulfilled.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: L'espantat Rei Lluís XVI, la Reina Maria Antonieta, els seus dos fills petits (Maria Teresa d'11 anys i Louis-Charles de quatre anys) i la germana del Rei, Madame Elisabet, van ser obligats per una multitud de dones comerciants a tornar cap a París des de Versalles el 6 d'octubre de 1789. En un carruatge, van tornar a París envoltats d'una multitud de gent que cridaven i baladrejaven amenaces contra el Rei i la Reina. La multitud va forçar el rei i la reina a dur les finestres del carruatge totalment obertes. En un cert punt, un membre de la multitud mostrà el cap d'un guàrdia reial assassinat a Versalles davant de la Reina horroritzada.
mt: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Maria Theresa, age 11, and Louis-Charles, age 4) and the King's sister, Madame Elisabeth, were forced by a mob of market women to return to Paris from Versailles on October 6, 1789. In a carriage, they returned to Paris surrounded by a mob of people who shouted and sang threats against the King and Queen. The mob forced the king and queen to keep the windows of the carriage completely open. At one point, a member of the mob showed the head of a slain royal guard to the horrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

La multitud va forçar el rei i la reina a dur les finestres del carruatge totalment obertes. En un cert punt, un membre de la multitud mostrà el cap d'un guàrdia reial assassinat a Versalles davant de la Reina horroritzada.
mt: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Maria Theresa, age 11, and Louis-Charles, age 4) and the King's sister, Madame Elisabeth, were forced by a mob of market women to return to Paris from Versailles on October 6, 1789. In a carriage, they returned to Paris surrounded by a mob of people who shouted and sang threats against the King and Queen. The mob forced the king and queen to keep the windows of the carriage completely open. At one point, a member of the mob showed the head of a slain royal guard to the horrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Poc després de l'inici de les hostilitats, la Bretanya inicià un bloqueig naval d'Alemanya. L'estratègia va demostrar ser efectiva, tallant els subministraments vitals de militars i de civils, encara que aquest bloqueig violava lleis internacionals generalment acceptades que havien estat codificades per diversos acords internacionals en els darrers dos segles. La Bretanya va minar les aigües internacionals per a evitar que qualssevol vaixells entressin en segments complets d'oceà, posant en perill fins i tot vaixells neutrals. Com que hi havia una resposta limitada a aquesta tàctica, Alemanya s'esperava una resposta similar a la seva guerra submarina sense restriccions.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Brittany began a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital supplies to both military and civilian, although this blockade violated generally accepted international laws that had been codified by several international agreements in the previous two centuries. Brittany mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire segments of ocean, endangering even neutral vessels. As there was a limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Als Estats Units d'Amèrica, hi ha aproximadament 400.000 casos coneguts d'Esclerosi Múltiple (EM), deixant-la com a la malaltia neurològica més comuna en joves i adults de mitjana edat. L'EM és una malaltia que afecta el sistema nerviós central, format pel cervell, la medul·la espinal i el nervi òptic. La recerca ha conclòs que les dones tenen el doble (2 vegades més) de probabilitats de patir esclerosi múltiple que els homes.
mt: In the United States, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the most common neurological disease in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Research has concluded that women have twice the chances of getting multiple sclerosis than men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: L'estudi va descobrir que la por i la catastrofizació van fer de mediador per a la relació entre el dolor i la discapacitat dels que pateixen mal d'esquena. Tan sols els efectes del catastrofisme, i no pas de la depressió o la por, estaven condicionats a les sessions regulars setmanals d'activitat física. Els qui practicaven una activitat regular van requerir més assistència en termes de percepció negativa del dolor, tot distingint les diferències entre el dolor crònic i les molèsties que provoca el moviment físic normal.
mt: The study found that fear and catastrophizing acted as a mediator for the relationship between pain and disability in those suffering from back pain. Only the effects of catastrophizing, and not depression or fear, were conditioned by regular weekly physical activity sessions. Those who practiced regular activity required more assistance in terms of negative perception of pain, distinguishing the differences between chronic pain and the discomfort caused by normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: L'esport modern de l'esgrima es practica a molts nivells, des dels estudiants que l'aprenen a la universitat fins als professionals i els competidors olímpics. Aquest esport es juga principalment en un format de duel, un esgrimista es bat en duel amb un altre.
mt: Modern fencing is practiced at many levels, from students learning it at university to professionals and Olympic competitors. This sport is played primarily in a duel format, one fencer fights a duel with another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: L'enverinament intern pot ser que no sigui evident immediatament. Símptomes, com el vòmit són prou generals, de manera que no es pot fer un diagnòstic immediat. El millor indici d'enverinament intern pot ser la presència d'un recipient de medicines obert o de productes químics domèstics tòxics. Cerqueu instruccions sobre primers auxilis específics per al verí específic en l'etiqueta.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting, are general enough that immediate diagnosis is not possible. The best indicator of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open medicine container or household toxic chemicals. Seek specific first aid instructions for the specific poison on the label.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Abans de comprovar l'estat de la víctima, heu d'inspeccionar l'escena a fi de garantir la pròpia seguretat. Heu d'observar la posició de la víctima així com us hi apropeu i qualsevol senyal d'alerta automàtica. Si et fas mal intentant ajudar, l'únic que aconseguiràs serà empitjorar la situació.
mt: Before checking on the victim, you should inspect the scene to ensure your own safety. You should observe the victim's position as you approach and any automatic warning signs. If you injure yourself trying to help, the only thing you will accomplish is making the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Hi ha molts d'efectes socials i polítics com l'ús del sistema mètric, un canvi de l'absolutisme al republicanisme, nacionalisme i la creença que el país pertany al poble i no a un sol governant. Igualment després de la Revolució, les ocupacions es van obrir a tots els homes que ho van sol·licitar permetent que els més ambiciosos i exitosos ho aconseguissin. Això s'aplica també als militars, perquè en lloc de basar els estaments de l'exèrcit en classes, a partir d'aquest moment es van basar en la rellevància. La Revolució Francesa també va inspirar moltes altres persones de la classe obrera reprimida d'altres països a començar les seves revolucions.
mt: There are many social and political effects such as the adoption of the metric system, a change from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief that the country belongs to the people and not to a single ruler. Similarly, after the Revolution, the occupations were opened to all men who requested it, allowing the most ambitious and successful to achieve it. This also applies to the military, because instead of basing the ranks of the army on classes, from this moment they were based on relevance. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working-class people from other countries to start their revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Tothom participa de la societat i usa sistemes de transport. Gairebé tothom es queixa dels sistemes de transport. Als països desenvolupats rarament sentiràs tantes queixes sobre la qualitat de l'aigua o l'esfondrament de ponts. Per què els sistemes de transports generen aquesta mena de queixes, per què fallen diàriament? És que els enginyers de transport són incompetents? O està succeint quelcom més fonamental?
mt: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about the quality of transportation systems. In developed countries, you rarely hear as many complaints about the quality of water or the collapse of bridges. Why do transportation systems generate this kind of complaints, why do they fail daily? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental happening?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: El Flux del Trànsit és l'estudi del moviment dels conductors individuals i els vehicles entre dos punts i les interaccions que s'estableixen entre ells. Malauradament, estudiar el flux del tràfic és difícil perquè no es pot preveure el comportament del conductor amb el cent per cent de certesa. Per sort, els conductors se solen comportar dins un rang considerablement constant; per tant, el flux del trànsit tendeix a tenir una constància considerable i pot ser aproximadament representat matemàticament. Per representar millor el flux del trànsit, s'han establert relacions entre les seves tres característiques principals: (1) cabal, (2) densitat i (3) velocitat. Aquestes relacions ajuden a la planificació, el disseny i les operacions de les instal·lacions de carreteres.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions that are established between them. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because one cannot predict the behavior of the driver with 100% certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a considerable range; therefore, traffic flow tends to have a considerable consistency and can be approximately represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between its three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and operations of road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: L'experiment de Hershey i Chase fou una de les primeres indicacions que l'ADN era un material genètic. Hershey i Chase van fer servir fags, o virus, per a implantar el seu propi ADN en un bacteri. Van fer dos experiments marcant l'ADN del virus amb fòsfor radioactiu o la proteïna del virus amb sofre radioactiu.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the first indications that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They performed two experiments marking the DNA of the virus with radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the virus with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Les mutacions poden tenir una varietat d'efectes diferents depenent del tipus de mutació, la importància del tros de material genètic afectat i si les cèl·lules afectades són cèl·lules de la línia germinal. Únicament les mutacions en les cèl·lules de la línia germinal es poden transmetre als fills, en canvi les mutacions a qualsevol altre lloc poden causar mort cel·lular o càncer.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected piece of genetic material, and if the affected cells are germ line cells. Only mutations in germ line cells can be transmitted to offspring, whereas mutations in any other location can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Les mutacions poden tenir una varietat d'efectes diferents depenent del tipus de mutació, la importància del tros de material genètic afectat i si les cèl·lules afectades són cèl·lules de la línia germinal. src: Sembla ser que les cabres es van domesticar per primer cop fa uns 10.000 anys a la serralada de Zagros, a l'Iran. Cultures i tribus antigues van començar a domesticar-les per disposar fàcilment de llet, pèl, carn i pell. Les cabres domèstiques se solien mantenir en ramats que pasturaven en turons o altres zones de pastura, sovint vigilades per pastors que solien ser nens o adolescents. Aquests mètodes de pasturatge encara s'utilitzen avui en dia.
mt: It seems that goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to domesticate them to easily obtain milk, wool, meat and skin. Domestic goats were usually kept in herds that grazed on hills or other grazing areas, often watched by shepherds who were usually children or adolescents. These grazing methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: El golf és un joc en què els jugadors utilitzen pals per colpejar pilotes i mirar de ficar-les en un forat. En una ronda habitual es juguen divuit forats; els jugadors solen començar pel primer forat del recorregut i acabar pel divuitè. Guanya el jugador que necessita menys cops, o swings del club, per a completar el circuit. A aquest joc s'hi juga sobre gespa i la gespa al voltant del forat se sega més curta i s'anomena green.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls and try to get them in a hole. In a typical round, eighteen holes are played; players usually start at the first hole of the course and end at the eighteenth. The player who needs fewer strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the circuit wins. This game is played on grass and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: L'objectiu principal de la ciència és esbrinar com funciona el món a través del mètode científic. De fet, aquest mètode guia la major part de la investigació científica. Ara bé, l'experimentació no és pas l'únic, i un experiment és una prova utilitzada per eliminar una o més de les possibles hipòtesis; la formulació de preguntes i d'observacions també guien la investigació científica.
mt: The primary goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. In fact, this method guides most scientific research. However, experimentation is not the only one, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses; the formulation of questions and observations also guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Els tornados colpegen una petita àrea en comparació a les altres tempestes violentes, però ho poden destruir tot al seu pas. Els tornados arrenquen arbres, trenquen les juntes dels edificis, i llencen cotxes enlaire. El dos per cent dels tornados més violents duren més de tres hores. Aquestes monstruoses tempestes tenen vents de fins 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes strike a small area in comparison to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees out of the ground, break the joints of buildings, and toss cars into the air. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. These monstrous storms have winds of up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Els tornados colpegen una petita àrea en comparació a les altres tempestes violentes, però ho poden destruir tot al seu pas. Els tornados arrenquen arbres, trenquen les juntes dels edificis, i llencen cotxes enlaire. El dos per cent dels tornados més violents duren més de tres hores. Aquestes monstruoses tempestes tenen vents de fins 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes strike a small area in comparison to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees out of the ground, break the joints of buildings, and toss cars into the air. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. These monstrous storms have winds of up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Els humans han fabricat i usat lents d'augment durant milers i milers d'anys. Ara bé, els primers telescopis vertaders es van fabricar a Europa a finals del segle XVI. Aquests telescopis feien servir una combinació de dues lents per a fer que els objectes llunyans apareguessin més a prop i més grans.
mt: Humans have made and used magnifying lenses for thousands and thousands of years. But the first true telescopes were made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
