src: Si vols veure món amb pocs diners, ja sigui per necessitat, estil de vida o repte, hi ha diverses maneres de fer-ho. Bàsicament, es divideixen en dues categories: o bé treballa durant el viatge o bé procura de limitar les teves despeses. Aquest article se centra en la segona opció. Per a aquells disposats a sacrificar el confort, el temps i la predictibilitat per a abaixar els costos prop de zero, vegeu viatge amb mínim pressupost. El consell assumeix que els viatgers no roben, ni transgredeixen, ni participen en el mercat il·legal, ni supliquen, i ni tampoc exploten altres persones pel seu propi guany.
mt: If you want to see the world on a shoestring, whether by necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are several ways to do it. Basically, they fall into two categories: either work during the trip or try to limit your expenses. This article focuses on the latter option. For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to lower costs to near zero, see shoestring travel. The advice assumes that travelers do not steal, trespass, participate in the black market, beg, and do not exploit other people for their own gain.
ref: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that. Basically, they fall into two categories: Either work while you travel or try and limit your expenses. This article is focused on the latter. For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to push expenses down close to zero, see minimum budget travel. The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain.

src: El tram entre Point Marion i Fairmont presenta les condicions de conducció més desafiants a l'autopista de Buffalo-Pittsburgh, que passa freqüentment per terrenys boscosos aïllats. Si no esteu acostumats a conduir per carreteres rurals, aneu amb compte: hi predominen els pendents pronunciats, els trams estrets i les corbes tancades. Els límits de velocitat indicats són notablement més baixos que els d'altres trams anteriors i posteriors - generalment 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) - i l'estricta obediència als límits és encara més important que si fos d'una altra manera. Tot i que resulta curiós, el servei de telefonia mòbil és més potent aquí que en molts altres segments de la ruta, com ara Pennsylvania Wilds.
mt: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Turnpike, which frequently passes through isolated wooded areas. If you are not used to driving on rural roads, be careful: there are steep inclines, narrow stretches, and tight curves. The posted speed limits are notably lower than those of other previous and subsequent segments - generally 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) - and strict adherence to the limits is even more important than otherwise. Although it is curious, the mobile phone service is stronger here than on many other segments of the route, such as Pennsylvania Wilds.
ref: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain. If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate. Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise. Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.

src: El barranquisme consisteix en arribar al fons d'un barranc, que pot ser sec o ple d'aigua. El barranquisme combina elements de la natació, l'escalada i el salt, però requereix relativament poc entrenament o forma física per a començar (en comparació amb l'escalada de muntanya, el submarinisme o l'esquí alpí, per exemple).
mt: Canyoning consists of reaching the bottom of a canyon, which can be dry or full of water. Canyoning combines elements of swimming, climbing and jumping, but requires relatively little training or physical fitness to start (in comparison to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).
ref: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water. Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).

src: "Pujar al cotxe i encetar un llarg viatge per carretera té un atractiu intrínsec en la seva simplicitat. A diferència dels vehicles de mida superior, segurament ja t'has familiaritzat amb la conducció del teu cotxe i en coneixes les limitacions. Instal·lar una tenda en una propietat privada o en un poble de qualssevol dimensions pot fàcilment cridar l'atenció de manera no desitjada. Per resumir, el cotxe és una molt bona opció per fer un viatge per carretera, però en si mateix no sol ser una forma d'""acampada"". L'acampada en cotxe és factible si tens una furgoneta, una berlina, un vehicle esportiu utilitari o un brec gran amb seients inclinables."
mt: "Climbing into a car and embarking on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity. Unlike larger vehicles, you've probably already familiarized yourself with the driving of your car and know its limitations. Installing a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily draw unwanted attention. To summarize, the car is a great option for a road trip, but in itself is not necessarily a form of ""camping"". Car camping is feasible if you have a van, sedan, sports utility vehicle or large SUV with reclining seats."
ref: "Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity. Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations. Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention. In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to ""camp"". Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down."

src: La moderna ciutat de Casablanca va ser fundada per pescadors amazics el segle X ANE, i fenicis, romans i benimerins la van fer servir com a port estratègic, que duia per nom Anfa. Els portuguesos la van destruir i la van tornar a construir sota el nom de Casa Branca, només per a abandonar-la després d'un terratrèmol en el 1755. El sultà del Marroc va reconstruir la ciutat amb el nom de Daru l-Badya, el nom de Casablanca prové dels mercaders espanyols que hi van establir bases comercials. Casablanca és un dels llocs menys interessants per a fer compres al Marroc. Als voltants de l'antiga Medina podem trobar fàcilment llocs de venda de productes marroquins tradicionals, com ara tajins, terrissa, objectes de pell, narguils, i un ampli ventall de souvenirs, però és tot pensat per als turistes.
mt: Casablanca was founded by Amazigh fishermen in the 10th century BC, and was used as a strategic port by Phoenicians, Romans and Benimerins, who called it Anfa. The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755. The Sultan of Morocco rebuilt the city under the name Daru l-Badya, the name Casablanca comes from Spanish merchants who established commercial bases there. Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in Morocco. Around the old Medina we can easily find places to sell Moroccan traditional products, such as tajins, pottery, leather goods, narguils, and a wide range of souvenirs, but it is all thought for tourists.
ref: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa. The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755. The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there. Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco. Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.

src: Cap al nord i d'accés fàcil es troba el poble romàntic i fascinant de Sintra, i que es va fer famós per als estrangers després d'un relat brillant dels seus esplendors enregistrat per Lord Byron. El bus d'Scotturb 403 va a Sintra de manera regular, aturant-se a Cabo da Roca. També al nord visiteu el gran Santuari de Nostra Senyora de Fàtima, un lloc d'aparicions marianes conegudes arreu del món.
mt: To the north and easily accessible is the romantic and fascinating village of Sintra, which became famous to foreigners after a brilliant account of its splendors recorded by Lord Byron. The Scotturb 403 bus goes to Sintra regularly, stopping at Cabo da Roca. Also to the north visit the great Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima, a Marian apparition site known around the world.
ref: To the north and within easy reach is the romantic and fascinating town of Sintra and which was made famous to foreigners after a glowing account of its splendours recorded by Lord Byron. Scotturb Bus 403 travels regularly to Sintra, stopping at Cabo da Roca. Also to the north visit the great Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima (Shrine), a place of worldwide famous Marian apparitions.

src: L'any 1994, la regió de l'Alt Karabakh de l'Azerbaidjan, d'ètnia armènia, es va alçar en guerra contra els àzeris. Amb el suport dels armenis, es va crear una nova república. Així i tot, no hi ha una nació establerta que ho reconegui de manera oficial - ni tan sols Armènia. Les discussions diplomàtiques sobre la regió segueixen minant la relació entre Armènia i Azerbaidjan.
mt: 1994, the region of Nagorno-Karabakh in Azerbaijan, of ethnic Armenian, rose up in war against the Azeris. With the support of the Armenians, a new republic was created. Nevertheless, there is no established nation that officially recognizes it - not even Armenia. Diplomatic discussions about the region continue to undermine the relationship between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
ref: In 1994, the ethnically Armenian Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan waged war against the Azeris. With Armenian backing, a new republic was created. However, no established nation - not even Armenia - officially recognizes it. Diplomatic arguments over the region continue to mar relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan.

src: Un dels punts forts de Charlotte, Carolina del Nord, és el seu alt nombre d'opcions d'alta qualitat per a famílies. Els residents d'altres zones solen mencionar la simpatia cap a les famílies com a motiu principal per a mudar-s'hi, i els visitants sovint troben que és fàcil gaudir de la ciutat amb nens. En els últims 20 anys el nombre d'opcions aptes per a nens a Uptown Charlotte ha augmentat exponencialment. Les famílies no solen usar els taxis a Charlotte, tot i que poden ser d'utilitat en determinats casos. Hi ha un recàrrec per tenir més de dos passatgers, de manera que aquesta opció pot ser més cara del compte.
mt: One of Charlotte's strong points is its high number of high-quality family options. Residents of other areas often mention the family friendliness as the main reason to move there, and visitors often find it easy to enjoy the city with children. In the last 20 years the number of family-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has increased exponentially. Families don't usually use taxis in Charlotte, although they can be useful in certain cases. There is a surcharge for having more than two passengers, so this option may be more expensive than expected.
ref: One of strong points of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that it has an abundance of high-quality options for families. Residents from other areas often cite family-friendliness as a primary reason for moving there, and visitors often find the city easy to enjoy with children around. In the past 20 years, the amount of child-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has grown exponentially. Taxis are not generally used by families in Charlotte, though they can be of some use in certain circumstances. There is a surcharge for having more than 2 passengers, so this option might be more expensive than necessary.

src: Abans de l'arribada dels espanyols el segle XVI, el nord de Xile estava sota domini Inca, mentre que els indígenes araucans (maputxes) poblaven el centre i sud de Xile. Els maputxes també van ser un dels últims grups indígenes americans que no es van veure plenament absorbits per la regulació hispanoparlant després de la independència de Xile. Tot i que Xile va declarar la independència l'any 1810 (en plena Guerra del Francès, que va deixar Espanya sense govern central funcional durant dos anys), no va obtenir la victòria decisiva contra els espanyols fins 1818.
mt: Before the arrival of the Spanish in the 16th century, the north of Chile was under Inca rule, while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuches) populated the center and south of Chile. The Mapuches were also one of the last indigenous American groups to be fully absorbed by the Hispanophone regulation after the independence of Chile. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (during the Napoleonic Wars, which left Spain without a functioning central government for two years), it did not achieve the decisive victory against the Spanish until 1818.
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: Abans de l'arribada dels espanyols el segle XVI, el nord de Xile estava sota domini Inca, mentre que els indígenes araucans (maputxes) poblaven el centre i sud de Xile. Els maputxes també van ser un dels últims grups indígenes americans que no es van veure plenament absorbits per la regulació hispanoparlant després de la independència de Xile. Tot i que Xile va declarar la independència l'any 1810 (en plena Guerra del Francès, que va deixar Espanya sense govern central funcional durant dos anys), no va obtenir la victòria decisiva contra els espanyols fins 1818.
mt: Before the arrival of the Spanish in the 16th century, the north of Chile was under Inca rule, while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuches) populated the center and south of Chile. The Mapuches were also one of the last indigenous American groups to be fully absorbed by the Hispanophone regulation after the independence of Chile. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (during the Napoleonic Wars, which left Spain without a functioning central government for two years), it did not achieve the decisive victory against the Spanish until 1818.
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: Les Cinque Terre, que vol dir Cinc Terres, comprenen els cinc pobles costaners de Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza i Monterosso, ubicats a la regió italiana de Ligúria. Estan recollides a la Llista dels Patrimonis de la Humanitat de la UNESCO. Al llarg dels segles, la gent ha construït amb cura fileres de cases adossades en el paisatge escarpat i abrupte fins als penya-segats que donen al mar. Part del seu encant és la manca de la construcció per part de l'home. Els camins, els trens i les barques connecten els pobles i els cotxes no hi poden arribar.
mt: The Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, consists of the five coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso, located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are collected in the World Heritage List of UNESCO. Over the centuries, people have built with care rows of houses attached to the rugged and steep landscape to the sea. Part of their charm is the lack of human construction. The paths, trains and boats connect the villages and cars can not get there.
ref: Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, comprises the five small coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. Part of its charm is the lack of visible corporate development. Paths, trains and boats connect the villages, and cars cannot reach them from the outside.

src: La causa més habitual dels accidents a l'hivern són les carreteres, els paviments (voreres) i sobretot els esglaons relliscosos. Pel cap baix, cal calçat amb soles adequades. Les sabates d'estiu normalment són molt relliscoses sobre el gel i la neu, fins i tot algunes botes d'hivern són deficients. El patró hauria de ser prou profund, 5 mm (1/5 polzades) o més, i el material prou tou en temperatures fredes. Algunes botes tenen talons i hi ha accessoris amb talons per a condicions relliscoses, adequats per a la majoria de sabates o botes, per als talons o per a la sola i taló. Els tacons haurien de ser baixos i amples. En les carreteres o camins sovint s'hi escampa sorra, grava o sal (clorur de calci) per a millorar-ne la tracció.
mt: The most common cause of winter accidents are roads, pavements (curbs) and especially slippery steps. For the low, proper footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inches) or more, and the material soft in cold temperatures. Some boots have heels and there are accessories with heels for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes or boots, for the heels or for the sole and heel. The heels should be low and wide. On roads or paths often sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is spread to improve traction.
ref: The most common cause for accidents in winter is slippery roads, pavements (sidewalks) and especially steps. At a minimum, you need footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures. Some boots have studs and there is studded add-on equipment for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes and boots, for the heels or heels and sole. Heels should be low and wide. Sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is often scattered on roads or paths to improve traction.

src: "Les illes Cook són un estat insular lliurement associat a Nova Zelanda, i es troben a la Polinèsia, al bell mig de l'oceà Pacífic sud. Es tracta d'un arxipèlag de 15 illes disseminades en 2,2 milions de km² d'oceà. Amb la mateixa zona horària que Hawaii, les illes de vegades es coneixen com ""Hawaii d'Oceania"". Tot i que són més petites, a alguns dels visitants de més edat els recorden a Hawaii abans que esdevingués un estat, sense els grans hotels turístics i la resta de construccions. A les illes Cook no hi ha cap ciutat, i consten de 15 illes. Les principals són Rarotonga i Aitutaki."
mt: "The Cook Islands are a self-governing associated state of New Zealand, and are located in the South Pacific Ocean, about halfway between Hawaii and New Zealand. They are a group of 15 islands spread over 2.2 million km² of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes known as "Hawaii of the South Pacific". Although smaller, some of the older visitors are reminded of Hawaii before it became a state, without the large tourist hotels and other buildings. There are no cities in the Cook Islands, and they consist of 15 islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."
ref: "The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as ""Hawaii down under"". Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development. The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."

src: Els permisos s'han de reservar amb antelació. Cal que tingueu un permís per a passar la nit a Sirena. Sirena és l'única estació de guardaboscos que ofereix allotjament a dormitoris i àpats a més a més del càmping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, i Los Patos només ofereixen càmping, sense servei de menjar. Es poden reservar permisos d'aparcament directament a l'estació de guardes forestals de Puerto Jiménez, però no accepten targetes de crèdit. El servei del parc (MINAE) no concedeix permisos d'accés amb més d'un mes d'antelació a l'arribada. Cafenet El Sol ofereix un servei de reserves per 30 dòlars dels EUA o 10 dòlars pels abonaments d'un dia. Per a més informació, visiteu la seva pàgina de Corcovado.
mt: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to spend the night at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos only offer camping, without food service. Permits for parking can be reserved directly at the ranger station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards. The park service (MINAE) does not grant access permits more than one month in advance of arrival. Cafenet El Sol offers a reservation service for $30 USD or $10 USD for day passes. For more information, visit their Corcovado page.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: Viatjant amb motxilla en esquís: aquesta activitat també s'anomena esquí rural, turisme d'esquí o excursionisme d'esquí. Hi està emparentat, però generalment no implica esquí alpí o muntanyisme, aquests darrers executats en terrenys rostos i que requereixen esquís i botes molt més rígids. Imagina't una ruta d'esquí com quelcom similar a una ruta de senderisme. En bones condicions, podràs recórrer distàncies una mica més llargues que caminant - tot i que en poques ocasions aconseguiràs la velocitat de l'esquí de fons sense una motxilla feixuga en pistes aplanades.
mt: Carrying a backpack on skis: this activity is also known as rural skiing, ski tourism or ski touring. It is related to, but generally does not involve alpine skiing or mountaineering, which are executed on steep terrain and require much stiffer skis and boots. Imagine a ski route as something similar to a hiking route. In good conditions, you can cover a bit longer distances than walking - although in few cases you will achieve the speed of cross-country skiing without a heavy backpack on flattened tracks.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

src: El xoc de retorn arriba abans que el xoc cultural (amb una fase de lluna de mel menor), dura més i pot ser més greu. Als viatgers als quals els ha estat fàcil d'adaptar-se a la nova cultura sovint els és particularment difícil de tornar-se a adaptar a la seva cultura nativa. Quan tornes a casa després d'haver viscut a l'estranger, ja t'has adaptat a una nova cultura i perdut alguns dels hàbits de la cultura natal. Quan vas anar l'estranger, al principi probablement la gent va ser pacient i comprensiva, sabent que els viatgers en un país nou necessiten adaptar-se. De vegades hom no preveu que també són necessaris paciència i comprensió quan els viatgers tornen a casa.
mt: The reverse culture shock comes before the culture shock (with a shorter honeymoon phase), lasts longer and can be more severe. Travelers who have easily adapted to the new culture often find it particularly difficult to re-adapt to their native culture. When you return home after having lived abroad, you have already adapted to a new culture and lost some of the habits of your native culture. When you went abroad, at first people were often patient and understanding, knowing that travelers in a new country need to adapt. Sometimes one does not anticipate that patience and understanding are also needed when travelers return home.
ref: Re-entry shock comes on sooner than culture shock (there's less of a honeymoon phase), lasts longer, and can be more severe. Travellers who had an easy time adjusting to the new culture sometimes have a particularly hard time readjusting to their native culture. When returning home after living abroad, you've adapted to the new culture and lost some of your habits from your home culture. When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. People may not anticipate that patience and understanding are also necessary for travellers returning home.

src: Els ants (també coneguts com uapitís) no són inherentment agressius, però es defensaran si perceben una amenaça. Quan la gent no veu els ants com animals potencialment perillosos, té tendència a acostar-se massa i, en conseqüència, pot posar-se en perill.
mt: Ants (also known as meerkats) are not inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people do not see ants as potentially dangerous animals, they tend to get too close and, as a result, they can put themselves in danger.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: Els viatgers poden veure miratges que generen una il·lusió d'aigua (o altres coses) amb la calor diürna. Això pot ser perillós si el viatjer persegueix el miratge, desaprofitant la preciosa energia i l'aigua restant. Fins i tot el desert més càlid pot esdevenir extremadament fred de nit. La hipotèrmia és un risc real sense roba d'abrigar.
mt: Passengers can see mirages that generate an illusion of water (or other things) with the daytime heat. This can be dangerous if the passenger pursues the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest desert can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.
ref: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). These can be dangerous if the traveler pursue the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest of deserts can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.

src: La República Dominicana (en espanyol: República Dominicana) és un país caribeny que ocupa la meitat oriental de l'illa de la Hispaniola, que comparteix amb Haití. El país allotja, a més de les platges de sorra blanca i els paisatges muntanyosos, la ciutat europea més antiga d'Amèrica, avui en dia part de Santo Domingo. L'illa fou habitada inicialment pels taïnos i els galibis. Els galibis eren un poble que parlava arauac que hi havia arribat cap a l'any 10.000 AEC. Pocs anys després de l'arribada d'exploradors europeus, els conqueridors espanyols van reduir la població de taïnos de manera significant. Segons Fra Bartolomé de las Casas (Tractat de les Índies), entre 1492 i 1498 els conqueridors espanyols van matar vora 100.000 taïnos.
mt: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. The country hosts, in addition to the white sand beaches and mountainous landscapes, the oldest European city in the Americas, today part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and the Galibis. The Galibis were a people who spoke Araucan that had arrived around the year 10,000 BCE. A few years after the arrival of European explorers, the Spanish conquerors significantly reduced the population of Taínos. According to Friar Bartolomé de las Casas (Treatise on the Indies), between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed about 100,000 Taínos.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: La República Dominicana (en espanyol: República Dominicana) és un país caribeny que ocupa la meitat oriental de l'illa de la Hispaniola, que comparteix amb Haití. El país allotja, a més de les platges de sorra blanca i els paisatges muntanyosos, la ciutat europea més antiga d'Amèrica, avui en dia part de Santo Domingo. L'illa fou habitada inicialment pels taïnos i els galibis. Els galibis eren un poble que parlava arauac que hi havia arribat cap a l'any 10.000 AEC. Pocs anys després de l'arribada d'exploradors europeus, els conqueridors espanyols van reduir la població de taïnos de manera significant. Segons Fra Bartolomé de las Casas (Tractat de les Índies), entre 1492 i 1498 els conqueridors espanyols van matar vora 100.000 taïnos.
mt: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. The country hosts, in addition to the white sand beaches and mountainous landscapes, the oldest European city in the Americas, today part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and the Galibis. The Galibis were a people who spoke Araucan that had arrived around the year 10,000 BCE. A few years after the arrival of European explorers, the Spanish conquerors significantly reduced the population of Taínos. According to Friar Bartolomé de las Casas (Treatise on the Indies), between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed about 100,000 Taínos.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: "Els esports alpins, que inclouen l'esquí i el surf de neu, són esports populars que consisteixen a lliscar per pendents coberts de neu costa avall amb uns esquís o una taula de surf lligada als teus peus. Esquiar és una activitat de viatge important amb molts d'entusiastes, sovint coneguts com a ""ski bums"", que planegen les vacances senceres al voltant de l'esquí a un lloc en particular. El concepte de l'esquí és molt antic  hi ha pintures rupestres simbolitzant esquiadors d'abans del 5000 aC! L'esquí alpí com a esport es remunta almenys al segle XVII, però va ser l'any 1861 quan uns noruecs van obrir el primer club d'esquí recreatiu a Austràlia."
mt: "Alpine sports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports that consist of sliding down snow-covered slopes headfirst with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is an important travel activity with many enthusiasts, often known as "ski bums," who plan entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The concept of skiing is very old  there are rock paintings symbolizing skiers from before 5000 BC! Alpine skiing as a sport dates back at least to the 17th century, but it was in 1861 that some Norwegians opened the first recreational skiing club in Australia."
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: Les Illes de l'Àfrica Oriental es troben a l'Oceà Índic davant la costa oriental de l'Àfrica. Madagascar és la més gran amb diferència, i un continent en si mateixa quant a la vida salvatge. La majoria de les illes més petites són nacions independents, o associades amb França, i són conegudes com a centres turístics de luxe a la platja. Els àrabs també van portar l'islam a les terres, i va emprendre un gran camí a les Comores i Mayotte. La influència europea i el colonialisme s'iniciaren al segle XV, quan l'explorador portuguès Vasco da Gama va trobar la Ruta del Cap d'Europa a l'Índia.
mt: The islands of the East African coast are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is the largest by far, and a continent in its own right as far as wildlife is concerned. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and are known as luxury beach resort centers. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and took a great step in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, when Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route of Europe to India.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: Hi ha la tradició de passar la nit de Pasqua fent la vetlla en algun lloc a cel obert per veure sortir el sol. Per descomptat, hi ha explicacions teològiques cristianes per a aquesta tradició, però és molt plausible que es tracti d'un ritual de primavera i fertilitat anterior al cristianisme. Les esglésies més tradicionals sovint celebren una Vigília Pasqual la nit de dissabte durant el cap de setmana de Pasqua, i les congregacions solen iniciar les celebracions al toc de la mitjanit per a celebrar la resurrecció de Crist.
mt: There is a tradition of spending the night of Easter Eve watching the sunrise in some open place to see the sun rise. Of course, there are Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it is very plausible that it is a spring and fertility ritual prior to Christianity. The more traditional churches often celebrate an Easter Vigil the night of Saturday during the Easter weekend, and congregations often begin the celebrations at the stroke of midnight to celebrate the resurrection of Christ.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: L'Equador requereix que els ciutadans cubans hagin rebut una carta d'invitació abans d'entrar a l'Equador a través d'aeroports internacionals o punts d'admissió fronterers. Aquesta carta ha de ser certificada pel Ministeri d'Afers Exteriors de l'Equador i complir certs requisits. L'objectiu d'aquests requisits és proveir un flux migratori organitzat entre ambdós països. Els ciutadans cubans que tenen una tarja verda dels EUA han de visitar el Consolat Equatorià per a obtenir una exempció a aquest requeriment. El passaport ha de ser vàlid durant com a mínim 6 mesos després de les dates del viatge. Es requereix un tiquet de viatge tancat/d'anada i tornada per demostrar la durada de l'estada.
mt: Ecuador requires Cuban citizens to have received an invitation letter before entering Ecuador through international airports or border entry points. This letter must be certified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ecuador and meet certain requirements. The purpose of these requirements is to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens with a green card from the US must visit the Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. The passport must be valid for at least 6 months after the dates of travel. A round-trip ticket is required to demonstrate the length of stay.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: Les ulleres poden ser més econòmiques en un país estranger, sobretot en països de baixos rèdits on els costos de producció són inferiors. Considereu realitzar-vos un examen ocular a casa, especialment si l'assegurança us ho cobreix, i porteu la recepta per a emplenar-la a qualsevol altre lloc. Les muntures de marques de luxe disponibles en aquestes zones poden tenir dos problemes: algunes poden ser imitacions, i les realment importades poden ser més cares que no a casa.
mt: Glasses can be cheaper in another country, especially in low-income countries where production costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if your insurance covers it, and bring the prescription to fill anywhere else. Luxury frames available in these areas may have two problems: some may be fakes, and the ones that are really imported may be more expensive than at home.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: La moneda oficial de les Malvines és la lliura de les Malvines (FKP), amb un valor establert equivalent al d'una lliura britànica (GBP). Els diners es poden bescanviar en l'únic banc de les illes, que es troba a Stanley, davant de la botiga FIC West. Generalment, les lliures britàniques s'accepten arreu de les illes i dins Stanley també s'accepten targetes de crèdit i dòlars dels Estats Units. A les illes perifèriques probablement no s'acceptaran targetes de crèdit, tot i que poden acceptar moneda britànica i estatunidenca; comproveu-ho amb els propietaris amb antelació per determinar quin mètode de pagament s'accepta. És gairebé impossible bescanviar moneda de les Malvines fora de les illes, de manera que cal fer-ho d'anar-vos-en.
mt: The official currency of the Falklands is the Falkland pound (FKP), with an exchange rate set equivalent to that of the British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank on the islands, which is located in Stanley, in front of the FIC West store. Generally, British pounds are accepted everywhere on the islands and within Stanley credit cards and U.S. dollars are also accepted. At the outlying islands it is unlikely that credit cards will be accepted, although British and U.S. currency may be accepted; check with the owners in advance to determine which method of payment is accepted. It is almost impossible to exchange Falkland money outside of the islands, so it is best to exchange it before leaving.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: La majoria dels temples celebren un festival anual que comença entre finals de novembre i mitjans de maig, i que varia d'acord amb el calendari anual de cada temple. La majoria dels festivals del temple se celebren com a part de l'aniversari del temple o de l'aniversari de la deïtat que presideix o qualsevol altre esdeveniment associat amb el temple. És molt interessant veure els festivals del temple de Kerala; hi ha processons periòdiques d'elefants endomassats, una orquestra del temple i altres festivitats.
mt: Most temples celebrate an annual festival that begins between late November and mid-May, and varies according to the annual calendar of each temple. Most temple festivals are celebrated as part of the temple's anniversary or of the anniversary of the deity presiding or any other event associated with the temple. It is very interesting to see the temple festivals of Kerala; there are periodic processions of caparisoned elephants, a temple orchestra and other festivities.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: La forma òbvia de volar en primera classe o classe business és pagar un bon feix de diners per aquest privilegi (o, encara millor, aconseguir que la vostra empresa ho faci per vosaltres). Ara bé, això no és pas barat: per normal general, podeu esperar pagar fins a quatre vegades el preu de la tarifa econòmica per la classe business, i fins a onze vegades a la primera classe! En general, no té sentit cercar descomptes en seients business o primera classe en vols directes d'A a B. Les companyies aèries saben bé que hi ha un cert grup de passatgers que estan disposats a pagar més pel privilegi d'arribar a un lloc de forma ràpida i còmoda, i pagar en conseqüència.
mt: The obvious way to fly first or business class is to pay a lot of money for this privilege (or, better yet, have your company do it for you). This, however, is not cheap: for the norm, you can expect to pay up to four times the price of the economy fare for business class, and up to eleven times for first class! In general, it does not make sense to look for discounts on business or first class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain group of passengers willing to pay more for the privilege of arriving at a place quickly and comfortably, and pay accordingly.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: Companyies aèries com ara Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways i Turkish Airlines han augmentat notablement els seus serveis a l'Àfrica, i ofereixen connexions a la majoria de grans ciutats africanes a preus més competitius que altres companyies europees. Turkish Airlines vola a 39 destinacions a 30 països africans des del 2014. Si et sobra temps per viatjar, calcula quant et costa en total el desplaçament a Àfrica en comparació amb una volta al món. No t'oblidis de comptar les despeses extres de visats addicionals, taxes de viatge, transport terrestre, etc. per a tots els llocs fora de l'Àfrica.
mt: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines have significantly increased their services to Africa, and offer connections to most major African cities at more competitive prices than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries since 2014. If you have time to spare, calculate how much it costs in total to travel to Africa compared to a round-the-world trip. Don't forget to count the extra costs of additional visas, travel taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all places outside of Africa.
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: Comprar menjar als supermercats sol ser la manera més barata d'alimentar-se. Ara bé, si no és possible cuinar, les opcions es limiten a menjar precuinat. Els supermercats tenen cada cop una oferta més variada de menjar preparat. N'hi ha que fins i tot ofereixen un microones o altres mitjans per escalfar els plats. A alguns països o tipus de botigues hi ha com a mínim un restaurant, sovint més bé informal amb preus assequibles.
mt: Buying food at supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to feed yourself. However, if cooking is not possible, the options are limited to precooked food. Supermarkets have increasingly varied offerings of prepared food. Some even offer a microwave or other means to heat the dishes. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one restaurant, often more informal with affordable prices.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: Les variants de francès que es parlen a Bèlgica i Suïssa són lleugerament diferents al francès que es parla a França. Tot i així, es tracta de variants suficientment similars, de manera que són mútuament intel·ligibles. En concret, el sistema de numeració als territoris francòfons de Bèlgica i Suïssa té una sèrie de petites peculiaritats que el diferencien del francès que es parla a França, i la pronunciació de certes paraules és una mica diferent. Això no obstant, tots els belgues i suïssos francòfons haurien après el francès a l'escola, per la qual cosa serien capaços d'entendre'l inclús si s'utilitzés el sistema de numeració francès estàndard.
mt: The French variants spoken in Belgium and Switzerland are slightly different from the French spoken in France. However, they are sufficiently similar that they are mutually intelligible. In particular, the number system in the French-speaking territories of Belgium and Switzerland has a series of minor peculiarities that distinguish it from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of certain words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all Belgian and Swiss French speakers would have learned French at school, so they would be able to understand it even if the standard French number system was used.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: Són poques les companyies aèries que encara ofereixen tarifes de dol, que redueixen una mica el cost d'un viatge funerari d'última hora. Entre les companyies que ho ofereixen hi ha Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa per a vols amb origen als EUA o el Canadà, i WestJet. En qualsevol cas, heu de reservar per telèfon directament amb l'aerolínia.
mt: Few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which reduce the cost of a last-minute funeral flight by a little. Among the airlines that offer them are Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating in the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. However, you have to book by phone directly with the airline.
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: Utilitzar aplicacions de navegació GPS al teu telèfon intel·ligent pot ser la manera més fàcil i còmoda de navegar fora del teu país d'origen. Podeu estalviar diners comprant nous mapes per a un GPS o un dispositiu GPS independent o llogar-ne un a una empresa de cotxes de lloguer. Si no tens una connexió de dades per al telèfon, o si et falta cobertura, el teu rendiment pot ser limitat o nul.
mt: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most comfortable way to navigate outside your home country. You can save money by buying new maps for a GPS or independent GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have data connection for your phone, or if you lack coverage, your performance may be limited or null.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: Els llocs i la vida salvatge de les Galápagos s'observen millor en barca, de la mateixa manera que ho feu Darwin el 1835. Més de 60 creuers naveguen per les aigües de les Galàpagos, amb capacitats d'entre 8 i 100 passatgers. La majoria dels visitants reserva la seva plaça amb força antelació, ja que els vaixells solen anar plens durant la temporada alta. Tingues per cert que l'agent que et fa la reserva és un especialista de les Galápagos amb un bon coneixement d'una gran varietat de vaixells. Això garantirà que els vostres interessos o limitacions particulars s'adaptin al vaixell més adequat.
mt: The best way to see the islands and their wildlife is by boat, just as Darwin did in 1835. More than 60 yachts cruise the waters of the Galápagos, with capacities between 8 and 100 passengers. Most visitors book their place well in advance, as the boats are usually full during the high season. Be sure that the agent who books you is a specialist in the Galápagos with a good knowledge of a wide variety of boats. This will ensure that your interests or particular limitations are matched to the most suitable boat.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: "Els casinos solen esforçar-se per maximitzar el temps i diners que els seus visitants hi deixen. No hi solen haver finestres ni rellotges, i les sortides poden ser difícils de trobar. Solen tenir aliments especials, begudes i ofertes d'entreteniment per animar els convidats i evitar que surtin de l'establiment. Alguns recintes ofereixen begudes alcohòliques dins al casa. Tanmateix, l'embriaguesa altera el judici, i tots els bons ""gamblers"" saben que és important mantenir-se sobris."
mt: "Casinos often try to maximize the time and money their visitors leave there. There are usually no windows or clocks, and exits can be hard to find. They often have special foods, drinks and entertainment to encourage guests and keep them from leaving the establishment. Some venues offer alcoholic drinks inside the house. However, intoxication impairs judgment, and all good ""gamblers"" know it is important to stay sober."
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: Tots els substantius, així com la paraula Sie per a vostè, comencen sempre amb majúscula, encara que es trobin al mig d'una oració. Aquesta és una bona manera de distingir alguns verbs d'objectes. Es pot afirmar que facilita la lectura, tot i que l'escriptura és una mica complicada perquè cal descobrir si un verb o adjectiu s'utilitza de forma substantivada.
mt: All nouns, as well as the word Sie for you, always start with a capital letter, even if they are in the middle of a sentence. This is a good way to distinguish some verbs from objects. It can be said that it facilitates reading, although writing is a bit complicated because you have to find out if a verb or adjective is used as a substantive.
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: "En moltes parts del món, moure la mà és un gest amistós que significa ""hola"". Ara bé, a Malàisia, si més no entre els malais de les zones rurals, vol dir ""vine cap aquí"", de manera semblant al gest del dit índex apuntant al propi cos que es fa servir en alguns països occidentals, i només s'ha d'utilitzar amb aquest propòsit. De la mateixa forma, un viatger britànic a Espanya pot confondre una salutació amb la mà amb el palmell mirant l'emissor (en lloc de la persona que rep la salutació) amb un gest perquè torni a rere."
mt: "In many parts of the world, moving the hand is a friendly gesture that means "hello". However, in Malaysia, at least among the rural Malays, it means "come here", similar to the index finger pointing to the body that is used in some Western countries, and only needs to be used for this purpose. Similarly, a British traveler in Spain can confuse a greeting with the hand with the palm facing the emitter (instead of the person receiving the greeting) with a gesture to return behind."
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: Les glaceres no són estables, sinó que flueixen per la muntanya. Això provocarà esquerdes, escletxes, que poden quedar ocultes amb ponts de neu. És possible que les parets i sostres de les coves de gel s'enfonsin i podria ser que les escletxes es tanquessin. A les vores de les glaceres hi ha grans blocs que es trenquen, cauen i de vegades salten o rodolen enfora de la vora.
mt: Glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause crevasses, cracks, which can be hidden with snow bridges. It is possible that the walls and ceilings of the ice caves will collapse and it could be that the cracks will close. At the edges of the glaciers there are large blocks that break, fall and sometimes jump or roll out of the edge.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: Goma és una ciutat turística de la República Democràtica del Congo, cap a l'extrem oriental, prop de Ruanda. L'any 2002, Goma va ser destruïda per la lava del volcà Nyiragongo, que va sepultar la majoria dels carrers de la ciutat, sobretot del centre. Si bé Goma és considerablement segura, convindria investigar abans de fer qualsevol visita fora d'aquesta ciutat per avaluar l'estat dels combats que persisteixen a la província de Kivu Nord. La ciutat també és la base per a escalar el volcà Nyiragongo i per a alguns dels seguiments de goril·les de muntanya més econòmiques a l'Àfrica. Podeu usar els boda-boda (taxis ciclomotors) per a moure-us per Goma. El preu normal (local) és d'uns 500 francs congolesos pel viatge curt.
mt: Goma is a tourist city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, near Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano, which buried most of the city's streets, especially the center. While Goma is considerably safe, it would be wise to investigate before making any visits outside of this city to assess the state of the fighting that persists in the province of North Kivu. The city is also the base for climbing the Nyiragongo volcano and for some of the cheapest gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use the boda-boda (motorcycle taxis) to move around Goma. The normal price (local) is about 500 Congolese francs for the short trip.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: Cal disposar d'un permís d'excursió per poder acampar per sota de la vora del Gran Canyó. Els permisos estan limitats per a protegir el barranc, i estan disponibles el 1r dia del mes, quatre mesos abans del mes d'inici. Així, un permís de camp per a qualsevol data de maig estarà disponible l'1 de gener. Els espais de les zones més conegudes, com ara el Campament de Bright Angel contigu al Phantom Ranch, se solen omplir amb les sol·licituds rebudes el primer dia en què estan obertes les reserves. Hi ha un nombre limitat de permisos reservats per a peticions d'accés a peu, disponibles per als que arribin primers.
mt: A permit is required to camp below the rim of the Grand Canyon. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and are available on the first day of the month, four months before the month of start. Thus, a camping permit for any date in May will be available on January 1st. Spaces in the more popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, are often filled with the requests received on the first day the reservations are opened. There is a limited number of permits reserved for foot access, available to those who arrive first.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: Alguns hotels tenen un llegat de l'edat daurada dels trens de vapor i els transatlàntics; abans de la Segona Guerra Mundial, al segle XIX o a principis del segle XX. Aquests hotels eren on s'allotjaven els rics i famosos del moment, i sovint tenien bon menjar i vida nocturna. Els accessoris vintage, la manca de les comoditats modernes i un cert envelliment elegant també formen part del seu caràcter. Tot i que solen ser propietats privades, de vegades acullen visites de caps d'estat i d'altres dignataris. Un viatger amb molts diners podria considerar fer la volta al món en avió, amb pauses per allotjar-se en molts d'aquests hotels.
mt: Some hotels have a legacy of the golden age of steam trains and transatlantics; before World War II, in the 19th or early 20th century. These hotels were where the rich and famous of the time stayed, and often had good food and nightlife. Vintage accessories, the lack of modern conveniences, and a certain elegant aging also form part of their character. Although they are often private properties, they sometimes host visits by heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveler with deep pockets might consider circumnavigating the globe by plane, with stops at many of these hotels.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: "Gràcies a les connexions mitjançant fils de fibra òptica submarins amb Europa i un satèl·lit de banda ampla, Groenlàndia està ben connectada amb un 93 % de la població amb accés a internet. El vostre hotel o amfitrió (si us quedeu a una pensió o a una casa privada) probablement tindrà wifi o un ordinador connectat a Internet, i tots els assentaments tindran un cibercafè o alguna localització amb wifi públic. Com ja s'ha dit abans, tot i que la paraula ""esquimal"" encara és vàlida als Estats Units, molts pobles àrtics que no pertanyen als EUA la consideren ofensiva, principalment al Canadà. Malgrat que podeu escoltar nadius de Groenlàndia utilitzant la paraula, els estrangers haurien d'evitar-ne l'ús. Els habitants natius de Groenlàndia s'autoanomenen inuits al Canadà i kalaalleq (plural kalaallit), un groenlandès, a Groenlàndia. El crim i la mala voluntat envers els estrangers en general gairebé no existeixen Groenlàndia. Ni tan sols hi ha ""zones perilloses"" a les ciutats. El temps fred és possiblement l'únic perill real al qual s'enfrontaran els poc preparats. Si visiteu Groenlàndia durant les estacions fredes (tenint present que com més al nord aneu, més fred farà), és essencial portar prou roba d'abrigar. Els dies d'estiu extremadament llargs poden comportar problemes per a dormir un temps suficient i problemes de salut associats. En l'estiu, aneu amb compte també amb els mosquits nòrdics. Tot i que no transmeten cap malaltia, poden ser irritants."
mt: "Thanks to fiber-optic submarine cable connections with Europe and a broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having access to the Internet. Your hotel or host (if you stay at a guesthouse or private home) will likely have Wi-Fi or a computer connected to the Internet, and all settlements will have a cybercafe or some location with public Wi-Fi. As mentioned before, although the word "Eskimo" is still valid in the United States, many Arctic communities that are not part of the United States consider it offensive, especially in Canada. Although you can hear Greenlandic natives using the word, foreigners should avoid its use. The native inhabitants of Greenland are called Inuit in Canada and kalaalleq (plural kalaallit), in Greenlandic. Crime and ill will towards foreigners in general almost does not exist in Greenland. Not even there are "dangerous areas" in the cities. The cold weather is probably the only real danger that the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during the winter seasons (remembering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring enough warm clothing. The extremely long summer days can cause problems with sleeping enough and health problems associated with it. In the summer, be careful also with the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any disease, they can be irritating."
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: Jardín de la Unión. Aquest espai es va construir com a claustre d'un convent del segle XVII, del qual el Templo de San Diego és l'única edificació que ha sobreviscut. Ara funciona com a plaça central i sempre hi passen moltes coses, tant de dia com de nit. Hi ha una sèrie de restaurants que envolten el jardí, i a la tarda i al vespre s'hi fan concerts gratuïts, sovint celebrats a la glorieta central. Callejón del Beso (Carreró del petó). Dos balcons separats per només 69 centímetres que són l'origen d'una antiga llegenda d'amor. Per uns pocs cèntims alguns nens us contaran la història.
mt: Garden of the Union. This space was built as a cloister of a seventeenth-century convent, of which the Temple of San Diego is the only surviving building. It now functions as a central square and always passes many things, both day and night. There is a series of restaurants that surround the garden, and in the afternoon and evening concerts are held, often celebrated at the central gazebo. Alley of the Kiss (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters that are the origin of an old love legend. For a few cents some children will tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: L'excursionisme és una activitat a l'aire lliure que consisteix a caminar en entorns naturals, sovint per rutes de senderisme. El senderisme d'un dia implica distàncies de menys d'una milla fins a distàncies més llargues que es puguin realitzar en un sol dia. Per a una excursió d'un dia per un camí senzill cal poca preparació, i qualsevol persona moderadament en forma s'hi pot unir. Les famílies amb nens petits poden necessitar més preparació, però un dia a l'exterior és fàcilment assolible amb nadons o infants de preescolar.
mt: Hiking is a form of walking, usually done with the specific purpose of exploring nature, and sometimes involving overnight stays. Hiking is done for recreation, sport, exercise, and tourism. Hiking is one of the most popular outdoor activities, providing many opportunities for self-reliant outdoor exercise. The term hiking is in itself somewhat vague, and is used for various purposes. It can mean walking outdoors for pleasure and recreation, which could be for walking any route, road or path, or walking for a specific self-propelled activity. The word hiking is also used in the UK, where the term walking may be used to denote walking in rural or mountainous areas.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: "Típics per a Noruega ho són els fiords empinats i valls que de sobte donen pas a un altiplà, més o menys alt. Aquests altiplans es denominen sovint ""vidde"", que vol dir espai amb amplitud, obert i que no té arbres, és a dir, una extensió il·limitada. A Rogaland i Agder se'ls sol anomenar ""hei"", que fa referència a un erm sense arbres i sovint cobert de bruc."
mt: "Typical for Norway are the steep fiords and valleys that suddenly give way to a plateau, more or less high. These plateaus are often called ""vidde"", which means space with amplitude, open and that does not have trees, that is, an unlimited extension. In Rogaland and Agder they are often called ""hei"", which refers to a heath without trees and often covered with heather."
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: La temporada turística de les estacions de muntanya normalment arriba al seu màxim durant l'estiu indi. Tanmateix, tenen una classe de bellesa i encant diferents a l'hivern, quan moltes estacions de muntanya reben grans quantitats de neu i ofereixen activitats com ara l'esquí o el surf de neu.
mt: The tourist season of ski resorts usually peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a class of beauty and charm different in the winter, when many ski resorts receive large amounts of snow and offer activities such as skiing or snowboarding.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: La temporada turística de les estacions de muntanya normalment arriba al seu màxim durant l'estiu indi. Tanmateix, tenen una classe de bellesa i encant diferents a l'hivern, quan moltes estacions de muntanya reben grans quantitats de neu i ofereixen activitats com ara l'esquí o el surf de neu.

src: Tingues per cert que una vegada entris al port esportiu tot serà molt evident. Coneixeràs altres autoestopistes de vaixell i compartiran la seva informació amb tu. Bàsicament, penjaràs anuncis oferint la teva ajuda, recorrent les dàrsenes, acostant-te a la gent que neteja els seus iots, intentant de fer contactes amb mariners al bar, etc. Intenteu parlar amb tanta gent com us sigui possible. Després d'un temps, tothom us coneixerà i us farà saber i donarà consells com ara quina barca busca algú.
mt: Once you enter the marina, everything will be very obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically, you will post ads offering your help, cruising the docks, approaching people who clean their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors at the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while, everyone will know you and will let you know and give you advice such as which boat is looking for someone.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.
